com.codecool.shop.controller

Class OrderController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.codecool.shop.controller.OrderController

  • public class OrderController
extends java.lang.Object
    OrderController is responsible for managing orders. In this app, an order contains all the items which were added to the cart. It stores all data in the current order via the OrderDaoMem implementation and also in the current session.

    • Method Detail

      • updateSession

        private static void updateSession(spark.Request req,
                                  Order currentOrder)
        This method updates the current sessions orderQuantity and orderPrice, which derive from the orders such fields.
        Parameters:
        req - the Request parameter is needed to handle the session.
        currentOrder - the current order contains all necessary information.

      • returnLineItemFromReq

        private static LineItem returnLineItemFromReq(spark.Request req)
        This method creates a LineItem based on the request from the webpage. It searches the product and gets the quantity needed, then instantiates and gives back a LineItem based on the information.
        Parameters:
        req - conatins information about the product and the quantity
        Returns:
        LineItem

      • findCurrentOrder

        private static Order findCurrentOrder(spark.Request req)
        This method will return an Order instance. If there is no orderId existing in the session, this method instantiates an Order and stores its id in the session. If there is already an orderId stored in the session, it will find the Order in the List of Orders by its id and return that Order.
        Parameters:
        req - is needed to handle the session.
        Returns:
        Order

      • addToCart

        public static org.json.simple.JSONObject addToCart(spark.Request req,
                                                   spark.Response res)
        This method is responsible for adding all the logic in this class together. It instantiates a LineItem based on the request, finds the current Order, adds the LineItem to the Order, Updates the session with all necessary Data. Then it also creates a json object from the quantity of all objects existing in the current order, which will be used by a JavaScript file, updating the number of all items in the cart via AJAX.
        Parameters:
        req - Request object is needed to handle session.
        res - Response object is needed by Spark.
        Returns:
        JSON Object for the AJAX
